column1: Topic title: 140K Umno members to celebrate party anniversary

column8: text

http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...sary-on-may-11/The StarMonday, 27 March 2017 | MYT 5:34 PM140,000 Umno members to celebrate party anniversary on May 11by razak ahmadKUALA LUMPUR: Umno will celebrate its 71st anniversary on May 11 with a massive gathering of 140,000 members at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil.  Executive secretary Datuk Seri Ab Rauf Yusoh (pix) told a media briefing Monday that the gathering will be attended by party president Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak, vice-president Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi and all other senior party members.  “The highlight of the Umno anniversary celebration this year will be to show that this party will still remain united under Barisan Nasional to face the next general election.  “It will also show that unity in Barisan Nasional is still solid under the leadership of Datuk Seri Najib,” Rauf said.  One of the highlights of the gathering that starts at 7pm will be a live telecast from the Putra World Trade Centre (PWTC).  The live telecast will show the groundbreaking ceremony for Umno’s new party headquarters that will be housed in a 70-storey tower built near the site of the current PWTC.  Various activities will be organised in the run-up to the gathering at the stadium.  They include a party flag run (larian bendera), an essay writing and drawing competition on the 2050 National Transformation (TN50) aspiration, and a two-day carnival on May 10 and May 11 outside the National Stadium.-----------------------------------Happy Birthday.  And motorists please take note.

http://www.malaysiakini.com/news/377223Umno's 71st anniversary to be 'biggest ever celebration'28 March 2017Umno’s 71st anniversary celebration on May 11 will be the biggest event ever held in the party's history, with an expected participation of more than 140,000 members nationwide.Umno executive secretary Ab Rauf Yusoh said in line with the prevailing 'mood' of the 14th general election (GE14), the forthcoming celebration must show unity in Umno, as well as the Barisan Nasional, as the people's choice (political) party."We expect each division to send 1,000 participants to the event on May 11 at the Bukit Jalil Stadium and with their presence, we want to implement the spirit of unity for the coming GE14."We are drafting the best essence to be presented at the celebration to show that Umno and BN are the best choice at the GE14," Ab Rauf told reporters after chairing a meeting of the technical committee for the anniversary celebrations at the Putra World Trade Centre in Kuala Lumpur yesterday.He said various events and programmes will be held in conjunction with the anniversary celebration, and some as early as the middle of next month at the divisional and state levels."There will also be a flag run from May 1, from the four corners of the country, namely Perlis, Kelantan, Johor and Sabah, and it will end on May 11, at the Bukit Jalil Stadium," Ab Rauf said.He said the celebration will then be focused at the Bukit Jalil Stadium on May 10-11 with various programmes and carnival activities, including lucky draws - with impressive prizes like six cars and 10 motorcycles - lined up and expected to attract about 200,000 visitors.He said this year's celebration will focus on the National Transformation 2050 (TN50) and a competition will be organised for them to showcase their creativity in patriotic writing and paintings.The competition will be opened to those aged 30 and below with prizes ranging from RM5,000 to RM20,000 and the details of this contest would be announced later, he said.Ab Rauf added that one of the highlights on May 11 would be a flag-raising ceremony and followed by a speech from Umno vice-president Ahmad Zahid Hamidi (currently handling the tasks of deputy president) and followed by a speech from Umno president Najib Abdul Razak.He said the event would continue with the groundbreaking ceremony for the KL Putra World Trade Centre, which includes the construction of a 70-storey tower as Umno's new landmark.The programme will be aired live.- Bernama
